subject: Career
title: The Thank-You Email That Works
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Thank-You Email That Works.

hook.text: A study found 80% of hiring managers consider thank-you emails when making decisions.

buildup.text: Most candidates send generic 'thanks for your time' notes. They're forgettable.

discovery.text: Reference a specific moment from the interview. 'Your point about X made me think about Y.'

twist.text: Send within 24 hours. After that, the interviewer's memory has faded and your note loses impact.

climax.text: A personalized thank-you does double duty: it reinforces your candidacy and shows follow-through.

punchline.text: The interview ends. The thank-you keeps selling.

quiz.question: When should you send a thank-you email after an interview?
options: Only if you get the job
